item.title: 3D Rasterizer
item.description: 3D Rasterizer in Python October 8, 2020 Task Description: For my Computer Graphics class, I created a 3D rasterizer that implements the pipeline for rasterizing triangles. Features: Transformations (model/view, projection, rotation, translation, scaling, and lookat) Per-pixel clipping - pixels with a z-value less than 0 or greater than 1 are not drawn Depth buffer check Implements DDA algorithm for drawing lines Supports sun lights coming from a specified direction Allows an arbitrary number of lights and sums their contributions Uses Lambert’s Law for illumination Improvements:

item.title: Mini Maya
item.description: Mini Maya with Processing and Arduino May 8, 2020 VIEW PROJECT VIDEO HIGHLIGHTS University of Virginia ARCH 5424 Final Project Description: I created a Processing and Arduino project incorporating concepts from the entire semester, including cinematography, computer vision, and microcontrollers. Features and Responsiblities: Built a “mini Maya” 3D modeling and rendering program with Processing Supports basic primitives, scaling, rotating, translating, and camera movement Includes a pre-loaded animation when “play” button is pressed Renders out frames to separate “data” folder in the current directory While rendering, displays status on external LCD monitor (Processing sends signals to Arduino program) Improvements:

item.title: Monte Carlo Path Tracer
item.description: Monte Carlo Path Tracer in C++ November 24, 2020 Utah Teapot (50 samples) Description: For my final project in Computer Graphics, I extended a ray tracer I wrote into a unidirectional path tracer. After the class was over, I translated my original Python implementation into C++ for performance purposes. Features: Monte Carlo sampling for global illumination Sampling of area lights (produces soft shadows) Color bleeding Gamma correction Ray-sphere, triangle, plane, and rectangle intersections Diffuse, reflective, and refractive materials Improvements:
